title: Any way to get back my old acc

embed.description: We track the millions of LoL games played every day to gather champion stats, matchups, builds & summoner rankings, as well as champion stats, popularity, winrate, teams rankings, best items and spells.

body:
I was toxic and i will say i deserved the ban... it will be a year soon so i was asking if it would be possible to get this account back since its my first one out there.

I'm playing on other now Kyman03 on EUNE (mods i think you can check it if i'm acting bad and answer or not up to you)

Its just kinda funny to look back at things u did and smile on how stupid one can be at times and i was indeed one stupid guy who was quick to anger and it slipped out into my personal life and i got beat up and learned my lesson. 

So as i said its up to mods to decide because i think it would be nice if players who are reformed (i maybe not it is for community to judge me on that) and i mean truly reformed, can get back in game on thiers original accounts as it might bring memories of some maybe first skins, or other things that can make people happy.

Anyways as i said it is you who decide how will this be not me.

Have it good in future fellow gamers and have fun :D!



(link to my main account:  https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/summoner/eune/Kyman03 )

replies.body: Pretty sure Riot is the only video game company that would go as far as to permanently ban someone for being mean to someone you'll never meet again in your life. There are far worse offenses worth banning like hard inting or afk behaviors, especially in a ranked environment. Honestly, as long as you weren't making death threats, I don't see why not. But it's highly unlikely they'll give you the chance because you're not Tyler1 or some other popular streamer. Riot stopped caring for their founding and casual player bases a long time ago.

yeah but tell me was it not worth a shot becaouse if it happend id get my account back and if not i dont lose anything

The mods aren't in charge of in-game punishments. They barely enforce Boards rules anymore. That said, your permanent ban is... well, permanent. Riot only lifts permabans when they were given in error, and you yourself admit that it was a correct punishment. Permabans happen because those players are extremely unlikely to reform. The time to reform was before your permaban, not after.
